personalInfo.splInterest: Playing hockey, skating, drawing golf courses, running and playing with his dog, favorite course - Merion, favorite professional team - Detroit Red Wings

tourBios.carHigh: 2011: Won the Cowans Ford Classic on the eGolf Tour. 2010: Missed the cut at the Web.com Tour's Preferred Health Systems Wichita Open and the PGA TOUR's Wyndham Championship, his only previous career starts on either Tour.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Was a two-time Mr. Golf in Michigan at Mona Shores High School (2004 and 2005)...Two-time AJGA All-American...First player to be named to the Michigan High School Activities Association Super Team for four years...Won the 2010 Byron Nelson Award at Wake Forest. Won the 2009 Porter Cup, 2008 Northeast Amateur and the 2008 Northeast Amateur. Four-time ACC All-Academic team member. Was the 2010 ACC Scholar Athlete of the Year. Two-time All-American scholar athlete and a 2010 Ping All- American.
tourBios.personal: Biggest thrill in golf is playing on the 2009 Walker Cup. Biggest thrill outside golf is meeting his wife...Favorite courses he has played include Merion and Augusta National...Never travels without lots of clothes...Has "too many superstitions to list" but always uses a Walt Disney World ball marker. Favorite websites include golfweek.com, espn.com and foxnews.com...Fan of the Detroit Red Wings...Favorite TV shows are "The O'Reilly Factor," "Three's Company" and "Friends." Enjoys all of the "Pirates of the Caribbean" movies. Loves pizza and chocolate malts. Favorite athletes to watch are Ernie Els and Aaron Baddeley. Loves to visit New York, and his top vacation site is Disney World...Twitter account is @brendangielow...Favorite gadget is his iPhone...Favorite apps are Twitter, Bible, ESPN and Fox News...Carries any type of fruit and Wheat Thins in his golf bag...Not many people know that he once scored three goals in 24 seconds in a hockey game.

tourBios.carHigh: 2012: Played three events on the Web.com Tour. 2011: Won the Cowans Ford Classic on the eGolf Tour. 2010: Missed the cut at the Web.com Tour's Preferred Health Systems Wichita Open and the PGA TOUR's Wyndham Championship, his only previous career starts on either Tour.

Won the 2009 Porter Cup, 2008 Northeast Amateur and the 2008 Northeast Amateur. Four-time ACC All-Academic team member. Was the 2010 ACC Scholar Athlete of the Year. Two-time All-American scholar athlete and a 2010 Ping All- American.
